Posts.Title: deformation after biopsy JDP KC1

Posts.Content: JDP wrote: A few months ago, I underwent a biopsy for ADH.  Fortunately, all of the offending tissue was removed and I am one of the lucky ones, though still considered high risk.  The problem is that the amount of tissue removed was large enough to leave my small breast looking very disfigured.  Have any of you undergone breast reconstruction and or augmentation after a biopsy or lumpectomy?  Is this something that is even done? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: deformation after biopsy JDP KC1

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 12:26PM JDP wrote: It sounds like most women prefer the monitored sedation. I have to admit to a silly remaining fear, though. I too had monitored sedation for an unrelated outpatient procedure last year, and afterwards, the nurses teased me about the talking I had done while undergoing the surgery. Fortunately, I hadn't said anything embarrassing, just talk about work and such. I've also heard similar stories from other women who didn't seem to mind much. However, I'm a private person by nature and the thought of not being in control of my talking frightens me, especially since there is a good chance of having people who know me (apart from medically) in the operating room. Also, because of a past very painful stereotactic biopsy, I"m afraid that by the time the wire localization is over I"ll be so nervous that general anesthesia would be best. I'm quite a sack of worries right now, but it is my nature. Has anyone out there faced the same fears? I know there is a lot more to be afraid of than this, so feel weird even asking..
Posts.Title: general or monitored JDP HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: JDP wrote: I'll be undergoing a wire-localized breast biopsy in a couple of weeks and have been given the option of general anesthesia or monitored sedation.  I'm wondering what I would expect with either.  Log in to post a reply
